sen.j: 彦主人王（ひこうしおう・ひこうしのおおきみ、生没年不詳）は、5世紀の皇族（王族）。
sen.e: Hikoushio (also pronounced "Hikousi no Okimi"; date of birth and death unknown) was an Imperial family (royal family) in fifth century.
Hikoushio (also pronounced Hikousi no Okimi; date of birth and death unknown) was a member of an Imperial family (royal family) in fifth century.
sen.cmt: a member of を補いました。" "は不要、かつ全角のため削除しました。
sen.e: Hikoushio (also pronounced Hikousi no Okimi; date of birth and death unknown) was a member of an Imperial family (royal family) in fifth century.

sen.j: 斯王（うしのおおきみ）とも。
sen.e: Also, Hikoushio was know as the "Ushi no Okimi."
Also, Hikoushio was known as Ushi no Okimi.
sen.cmt: know => knownに修正しました。名前の前のtheを削除しました。" "は不要、かつ全角のため削除しました。
sen.e: Also, Hikoushio was known as Ushi no Okimi.

sen.j: 父は乎非王（おいのおおきみ）で、母は久留比売命。
sen.e: His father was 'Oi no Okimi' and his mother was 'Kurume no Mikoto.'
His father was Oi no Okimi and his mother was 'Kurume no Mikoto.'
sen.cmt: ’は不要、かつ全角のため削除しました。
sen.e: His father was Oi no Okimi and his mother was 'Kurume no Mikoto.'

sen.j: 応神天皇の玄孫に当たる。
sen.e: Hikoushio was a great-great-grandchild of the Emperor Ojin.
Hikoushio was a great-great-grandchild of the Emperor Ojin.
Hikoushio was a great-great-grandchild of the Emperor Ojin.

sen.j: 垂仁天皇の7世孫とされる振媛命（ふりひめのみこと。父は乎波智君）を妃とし、男大迹王（おおどのおおきみ、後の継体天皇）を儲けた。
sen.e: Hikoushio married 'Furihime no Mikoto,' a descendent and grand child of the Emperor Suinin (seventh generation descended from him)

Hikoushio married Furihime no Mikoto (her father was Ohachigimi), a descendent and a grand child of the Emperor Suinin (seventh generation descended from him) and as his princess, she bore him a son, 'Odo no Okimi' (Later, he became the Emperor Keitai.).
sen.cmt: grand childの前にaを追記しました。原文が2文に分かれたままのため、1文とし、本列に1文にした英文を入力しました。漢字名はここでは話題ではないため、削除しました。全角だった' 'を半角に修正しました。
sen.e: Hikoushio married Furihime no Mikoto (her father was Ohachigimi), a descendent and a grand child of the Emperor Suinin (seventh generation descended from him) and as his princess, she bore him a son, 'Odo no Okimi' (Later, he became the Emperor Keitai.).

sen.j: 『日本書紀』や『釈日本紀』に引く「上宮記」。
sen.e: The authors and editors on the book of "Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan)" and "Shaku Nihongi (annotated text of the Nihon Shoki)" often consulted the "Joguki (Record of the Crown Prince)" for reference when writing articles on those same books.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The authors and editors on the book of "Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan)" and "Shaku Nihongi (annotated text of the Nihon Shoki)" often consulted the "Joguki (Record of the Crown Prince)" for reference when writing articles on those same books.
sen.cmt: " "が全角だったため、半角に修正しました。
sen.e: The authors and editors on the book of "Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan)" and "Shaku Nihongi (annotated text of the Nihon Shoki)" often consulted the "Joguki (Record of the Crown Prince)" for reference when writing articles on those same books.

sen.j: その、逸文によれば、彦主人王は近江国高島郡におり、三国坂中井（福井県坂井郡）の振媛を娶って男大迹王を生んだ。
sen.e: Then, according to the Joguki, a written article of unidentifiable origin, stated the following: When Hikoushio was in Takashima County of Omi Province, he married Furihime, who was in Mikuni Sakanakai (Sakai County, Fukui Prefecture); and then she gave birth to Odo no Okimi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then, according to the Joguki, a written article of unidentifiable origin, stated the following: When Hikoushio was in Takashima County of Omi Province, he married Furihime, who was in Mikuni Sakanakai (Sakai County, Fukui Prefecture); and then she gave birth to Odo no Okimi.

Then, according to the Joguki, a written article of unidentifiable origin, stated the following: When Hikoushio was in Takashima County of Omi Province, he married Furihime, who was in Mikuni Sakanakai (Sakai County, Fukui Prefecture); and then she gave birth to Odo no Okimi.

sen.j: しかし、子が幼少のうちに彦主人王は薨去。
sen.e: However, the young son, while still a child of early years, lost his father Hikoushio, who faced Kokyo (death of a man of upper than Third Rank).
However, the young son, while still a child of early years, lost his father Hikoushio, who faced Kokyo (death of a man of upper than Third Rank).
However, the young son, while still a child of early years, lost his father Hikoushio, who faced Kokyo (death of a man of upper than Third Rank).

sen.j: 振媛は高向（坂井郡丸岡町）に帰郷して、男大迹王を養育したという。
sen.e: Furihime retuned to her home, Takamuku (Maruoka-Cho, Sakai County), and then reared and attended to the needs of Odo no Okimi.
Furihime retuned to her home, Takamuku (Maruoka-Cho, Sakai County), and then reared and attended to the needs of Odo no Okimi.
Furihime retuned to her home, Takamuku (Maruoka-Cho, Sakai County), and then reared and attended to the needs of Odo no Okimi.

sen.j: 506年、武烈天皇が継嗣なく崩御したため、57歳の男大迹王は大伴金村や物部麁鹿火らの推薦があり。
sen.e: In '506', because the Emperor Buretsu met with his demise, and no apparent heir to succeed him, 'Odo no Okimi,' now fifty-seven years old, was recommended to be okimi (great king) by 'OTOMO no Kanamura' and 'MONONOBE no Arakahi.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Because the Emperor Buretsu passed away without an apparent heir to succeed him in 506, Odo no Okimi, who was fifty-seven years old at that time, was recommended to be okimi (great king) by OTOMO no Kanamura and MONONOBE no Arakahi.
sen.cmt: 年号の前後の、' ' を削除しました。年号の位置もbecause節のなかに入れました。「継嗣なく崩御した」の表現を修正しました。Nowは文脈上不適切であるため、修正しました。' 'は不要、かつ全角のため削除しました。
sen.e: Because the Emperor Buretsu passed away without an apparent heir to succeed him in 506, Odo no Okimi, who was fifty-seven years old at that time, was recommended to be okimi (great king) by OTOMO no Kanamura and MONONOBE no Arakahi.

sen.j: それにより、大王として擁立された（継体天皇）。
sen.e: Then, 'Odo no Okimi' ascended to the throne (the Emperor Keitai).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then, Odo no Okimi ascended to the throne (the Emperor Keitai).
sen.cmt: 'は不要、かつ全角のため削除しました。
sen.e: Then, Odo no Okimi ascended to the throne (the Emperor Keitai).

sen.j: 記紀は継体を応神天皇の5世孫としている。
sen.e: According to Kiki ("A Record of Ancient Matter" and "Chronicles of Japan"), the Emperor Keitai was a fifth generation descendent grandchild of the Emperor Ojin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: According to Kiki ("A Record of Ancient Matter" and "Chronicles of Japan"), the Emperor Keitai was a fifth generation descendent grandchild of the Emperor Ojin.
According to Kiki ("A Record of Ancient Matter" and "Chronicles of Japan"), the Emperor Keitai was a fifth generation descendent grandchild of the Emperor Ojin.

sen.j: 「上宮記」には、「凡牟都和希王（応神） ― 若野毛二俣王 ― 大郎子（意富富杼王） ― 乎非王（私斐王） ― 斯王 ― 乎富等大公王（継体）」の文章系譜が記される。
sen.e: In "Joguki," there was a written genealogy, "Homutawake no Miko' (Ojin) –'Wakanuke futamata no Miko' – 'Oiratsuko' (Ohodo no Okimi) – 'Oi no Okimi' [Oi no Okimi (私斐王)] - 'Okimi' (斯王) – 'Odo no Okimi' (Keitai)."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 'Joguki,' there was a written genealogy, 'Homutawake no Miko (Ojin) –Wakanuke futamata no Miko - Oiratsuko (Ohodo no Okimi) - Oi no Okimi (Oi no Okimi [私斐王]) - Okimi - Odo no Okimi (Keitai).'
sen.cmt: ” ”、’ ’について不要なものは削除、全角のものは半角に修正しました。（ ）[ ]を仕様書に従い修正しました。ハイフンも半角にしました。
sen.e: In 'Joguki,' there was a written genealogy, 'Homutawake no Miko (Ojin) –Wakanuke futamata no Miko - Oiratsuko (Ohodo no Okimi) - Oi no Okimi (Oi no Okimi [私斐王]) - Okimi - Odo no Okimi (Keitai).'

sen.j: しかし、即位の正統性を主張するための作為と見做す説も根強くある。
sen.e: However, some historians and scholars strongly argued for their opinions, as to the possibility that the genealogy might be a fabrication, which was intended to declare the legitimacy in the enthronement of the Emperor Keitai.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, some historians and scholars strongly argued for their opinions, as to the possibility that the genealogy might be a fabrication, which was intended to declare the legitimacy in the enthronement of the Emperor Keitai.

However, some historians and scholars strongly argued for their opinions, as to the possibility that the genealogy might be a fabrication, which was intended to declare the legitimacy in the enthronement of the Emperor Keitai.

sen.j: 実際の出自を息長氏などの地方豪族に求める説も有力となっている。
sen.e: Thus, some historians and scholars searched for support in fact, that the actual origin of the Emperor Keitai accession, may have been the powerful local clans such as, the Okinaga clan, and this theory was supported through historical study.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Thus, some historians and scholars searched for support in fact, that the actual origin of the Emperor Keitai accession, may have been the powerful local clans such as, the Okinaga clan, and this theory was supported through historical study.

Thus, some historians and scholars searched for support in fact, that the actual origin of the Emperor Keitai accession, may have been the powerful local clans such as, the Okinaga clan, and this theory was supported through historical study.

sen.j: なお、滋賀県高島市安曇川町には彦主人王の墓と伝える田中王塚古墳（円墳・径58m、俗称ウシ塚）が所在する。
sen.e: Additionally, there is Tanaka Ozuka Kofun [Enpun (a circular type tumuli); the diameter is fifty-eight meters long; and the familiar name is "Ushizuka"] which is believed to be a tomb of Hikoushio, located in Adogawa-Cho, Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Additionally, there is Tanaka Ozuka Kofun (Enpun [a circular type tumuli]; the diameter is fifty-eight meters long; and the familiar name is Ushizuka) which is believed to be a tomb of Hikoushio, located in Adogawa-Cho, Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: ” ”、’ ’について不要なものは削除しました。（ ）[ ]を仕様書に従い修正しました。
sen.e: Additionally, there is Tanaka Ozuka Kofun (Enpun [a circular type tumuli]; the diameter is fifty-eight meters long; and the familiar name is Ushizuka) which is believed to be a tomb of Hikoushio, located in Adogawa-Cho, Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: それは、陵墓参考地として宮内庁が管理している。
sen.e: The Imperial Household Agency manages the Tanaka Ozuka Kofun as a primary referable mausoleum.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Imperial Household Agency manages the Tanaka Ozuka Kofun as a primary referable mausoleum.
The Imperial Household Agency manages the Tanaka Ozuka Kofun as a primary referable mausoleum.

sen.j: が、同市鴨の稲荷山古墳（前方後円墳・全長45m、仮葬陵ともいう）を墓とする別伝もある。
sen.e: However, there is the Kamoinariyama Kofun [the keyhole-shaped mound; the length of which is forty–five meters; it is also called, "Kasoryo (temporally burial of Emperor's tomb)] in Takashima City, and some historians and scholars believe in the theory that Kamoinariyama Kofun is the tomb of Hikoushio.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, there is the Kamoinariyama Kofun (the keyhole-shaped mound; the length of which is forty–five meters; it is also called, Kasoryo [temporally burial of Emperor's tomb]) in Takashima City, and some historians and scholars believe in the theory that Kamoinariyama Kofun is the tomb of Hikoushio.
sen.cmt: 原文と英訳が一致しません。（部分的に一致するが、原文にない表現が英訳にあります。）「鴨の稲荷山古墳」の読みに「の」がもれています。” ”、’ ’について不要なものは削除しました。（ ）[ ]を仕様書に従い修正しました。
sen.e: However, there is the Kamoinariyama Kofun (the keyhole-shaped mound; the length of which is forty–five meters; it is also called, Kasoryo [temporally burial of Emperor's tomb]) in Takashima City, and some historians and scholars believe in the theory that Kamoinariyama Kofun is the tomb of Hikoushio.
